intro: Chevaliera rodriguesiana, commonly known as Rodrigues's chevaliera, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has small, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
